sen.j: 安富 元綱（やすとみ もとつな）は、室町時代の武将。
sen.e: Mototsuna YASUTOMI was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Muromachi period.

He was a kasai (main retainer) as well as a steward at the Hosokawa clan.

sen.j: 細川京兆家の重臣として讃岐国東方守護代を世襲していた安富氏の一族、もしくは惣領。
sen.e: He was from the Yasutomi clan, a chief vassal clan of the Hosokawa-Keicho family, and they handed down a position of Shugodai (the acting Military Governor) of the eastern region of Sanuki Province for generations; additionally, he was a soryo (heir) of the clan.

sen.j: 元綱は細川勝元に仕え、家宰として京都で勝元に近侍していた。
sen.e: Mototsuna served Katsumoto HOSOKAWA and attended him as a kasai in Kyoto.

sen.j: 応仁元年（1467年）に応仁の乱が起こると、元綱は香川氏とともに讃岐の軍勢を指揮し京都を転戦。
sen.e: Once the Onin War occurred in 1467, Mototsuna took part in various battles in Kyoto together with the Kagawa clan at the head of an army from Sanuki Province.

sen.e: Once the Onin War started in 1467, Mototsuna took part in various battles in Kyoto together with the Kagawa clan as the head of an army from Sanuki Province.

sen.j: また、安富氏は山城西岡の野田氏らも被官化していたようで、元綱は彼らも率いて軍事行動をしていたことが諸史料に見える。
sen.e: Additionally, it is thought that the Yasutomi clan also had the Noda clan, who was from Nishioka, Yamashiro Province, as their vassal, and various materials have it that Mototsuna took military action taking command of them as well.

sen.j: 戦局が西軍有利となる中、応仁元年（1467年）10月、西軍は東軍の本陣であった相国寺を一気に攻撃した（相国寺の戦い）。
sen.e: As the tide of the war turned in favor of the Western Camp, the Western Camp made an all-out attack on Shokoku-ji Temple, which was the headquarters of the Eastern Camp, in November 1467 (this battle is called the Battle of Shokoku-ji).

sen.j: 元綱は三千騎を率いて相国寺を守ったが、一部の僧侶が西軍に内応して相国寺内部から火を放ったことから東軍側は動揺し総崩れとなった。
sen.e: Although Mototsuna attempted to defend Shokoku-ji Temple with 3,000 horsemen against the attack, part of Buddhist priests who communicated secretly with the Western Camp set fire to the inside of Shokoku-ji Temple, and consequently, the Eastern Camp became upset and they completely collapsed.

sen.j: 元綱は敵の猛攻撃を押し返し奮戦したものの、激戦の末、弟の盛継とともに壮絶な戦死を遂げた。
sen.e: Mototsuna fought to the last man against the enemy's fierce attack, but he and his younger brother Moritsugu met a heroic end after this fierce battle.
Mototsuna fought to the last man against the enemy's fierce attack, eventually, he and his younger brother Moritsugu, were victorious after this fierce battle.

sen.e: It is said that Mototsuna enjoyed the fullest confidence of Katsumoto HOSOKAWA, and Katsumoto was very heartbroken over Mototsuna's death in the battle.

sen.j: 元綱自身は応仁の乱で戦死したが、近世に作成された「南海通記」などの史料には16世紀以降においても讃岐での元綱の活動が記されている。
